name: AMBER GHOST PITS
short description: Hundreds of open, jagged craters in the sandstone earth; jutting from each one crystallized amber hinting at smoky, still bestial shapes inside and reaching out; misty, luscious willow trees casting their bushy branches at the ground and hiding globular purple catkins swaying inside;

name: ARARIEL
short description: (she, her, hers) Arariel is an angel who, according to the rabbis of the Talmud, takes charge of the waters of the earth. Fishermen invoke her so that they may take large fish. Arariel has also traditionally been invoked as a cure for stupidity.

name: Dalariel's Pond
short description: Large pond with spouts of sparkling water arching over it and submerging again like a gyroscope; gives off a massive amount of light; lazy fish people sunning themselves on the shore behind umbrella-like structures made of this ... wood; three flat stone altars in triangle vertices around the gyroscope.

When you attain rank 4, you gain a small tome that is an uncommon magic item. The elder cartographer's glossography grants advantage on Intelligence or Wisdom checks related to geographical features or locations.

name: BATHYBIUS
short description: artisinally dressed' according to Thuridan. part of a homeric warrior-poet society of ghouls, and a bit over-refined, having never recited a poem from memory (true work), left his family in order to pursue his dreams of metallurgy, believing that a certain type of peat useful for creating alloys could be extracted from the marshes around Marshbout. Though his family was dismissive of him while he stayed among their people, his prolonged absence has caused them a great deal of concern. He might also be reluctant to return, or shake himself from this magical lethargy, in order to avoid a confrontation with his affianced (who may shortly come looking for him), partly due to a co-dependent relationship he has with a swamp hag (green hag) named Talma (aka Meliona) of the Foed Coven.

name: concentrate on 2 spells at a time
short description:
(1) roll concentration checks at disadvantage, and looses both

(3) roll regular, lose both
(4) roll advantage on one or other
(5) roll advantage on both

name: FAMASTA MONASTERY
short description: Building of four stories with a sharp slate roof, tiny bay windows poking out of the third story. The bottom two floors are a pale yellow with regular windows along each floor, and a huge wooden door that spans the two floors. At the top is a clock tower. It sits in the middle of a cobblestone courtyard. Gargoyles up at the top. Pale whitish-yellow stucco. (magic stucco)

name: FEISTY GLADE OF LORE
short description: Majestic gnolls carved from the living wood in various postures of heroic & domestic triumph; utter silence broken by deep bass rumbles as if in response to entrants; straw costumes of the intelligent beasts of the forest.

name: FIRBOLG BOWER
short description: Expansive cave roofed by the canopy of titanic, gnarled oaks with branches in the earth and roots in the air; space suffused with orange light; no visible sun; occasional grey gust devils of archaic portent; wooly trolls grazing like sheep; 'dimensional pocket'; trees on the border just have leaves and roots together growing from their trunks.

short description: A corpus of An Duina Crochta (ahn dunna kroxta)  (“The Hanged Person”), a twilight-purple gnoll in hangman card’s position, only his tail is long like a monkey’s and is being used as the noose; lush gardens amidst crumbling ruins and adjacent to a tidy plot of rotting leaves, rinds, pine needles, litterfall, and other plant material; smoke house; bow longhouse; central lodge; altar.

name: GROUNDSINK DWARF MINE ENTRANCE
short description: Huge stones columns carved with dwarven glyphs (but not any dwarven language) set into a sudden peak of rock; two stone doors of preternaturally precise construction block the entrance; a crackling magic field sputters and sparkles and afflicts creatures as they approach.

name: HARENA / GRENLICH’S IMMOR
short description: A patchwork of squat, thick-boled, leafless trees from which bulge slimy, doglike heads, bodies, and legs; bulky chartreuse succulents with velveteen leaves and a single, 4-meter high stalk excreting a sweet-smelling, ammoniac oil; small pyramidal dolmens criss-crossed by sinews and ligaments; reproduction in miniature and inverted of a gnoll camp.

name: Inaris
short description: (female half-elf monk?) 3/4 length jacket over a frilly shirt; wide belt with an intricate celtic knot; simple cloth pants and cloth boots. Left eye in a permanent squint, long face, delicate unibrown, short wavy brown hair.

( 'A real beauty') Dwarven city under Grey Tongue.

if they go to keep gnomes and learn about the xorn, they also learn that weird stuff is happening down near the slubber with the … whatever that thing is down there.
Xorn scour the depths of the earth for precious metal and stones. Because they are unable to consume organic material, they ignore most other creatures. However, a xorn's ability to sniff out metals and stones often draws its attention to adventurers carrying coins and gems. Because a xorn isn't evil, it pleads or bargains in the hope of convincing owners to give up their treasure, offering up information it has learned from its travels in exchange. A xorn whose requests are ignored might resort to threats and bullying. If starving or angered, it resorts to force.

name: Kyra (k-eye-ra) Mejirri
short description:
80 year old Earth Genasii (transmutation school wizard and archaeologist)
appearance
has the rock equivalent of hairiness (spots of lichen, or lichen-covered skin)
light brown to reddish black, quartz-like sparkles, lichen spots)
clothing: keeps damp curl-papers (papillote) in her hair, because the rocks are always drying it out
possessions
bags / satchels / pockets absolutely overflowing with personalia (writings, drawings, sketches, etchings, manuscripts, annotations, memoirs)

short description:
Wondrous item, uncommon. A glowing purple. purple. 5 temporary hit points, and +5 to speed for one minute or until none of those temporary hit points remain.
vomited up afterwards. the item is inert until after the next long rest.
The next long rest, make a DC 15 Charisma Check. On a failure, slothful: that long rest requires an extra 2 hours and they have bad dreams.

name: SNOWFIELD MAN. Metoh Kangmi
short description: The problematic phrase was metoh kangmi: 'filthy snowman.' One reporter took the word for 'filthy,' however, as abominable: 'repugnantly hateful; detestable; loathsome.' But the phrase metoh kangmi was probably misrendered from the Tibetan mi t'om, meaning 'man-bear,' and k'ang mi, for 'snowfield man.'

name: Trident of Warning
short description: Trident, uncommon (requires attunement). This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

name: Zorbon gravity orb
short description:
Edible, uncommon
The orb is about six inches in diameter and constructed of a lustrous, metallic black substance. When held in the hand it changes size to fit comfortably in the palm. If you attempt to consume the orb, it shrinks to the size of a small berry relative to your size. After consumption, your speed drops to 1, you cannot become prone, and you have +5 to any Acrobatics checks made. The effect lasts for one munte, after which the orb is ejected from the creature’s preferred orifice. Consuming takes one action. The effect can be ended at any time by using a bonus action. This effect can be used once per day per creature (resetting at dawn). It time a creature uses it in a day beyond that first use, their Constitution drops by 3. Constitution points lost in this way cannot be healed with magic and are regained at the next dawn.

Infernal Tack
short description:
Infernal Tack
MTF
p167
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement by a creature of evil alignment.)
A narzugon binds a nightmare to its service with infernal tack, which consists of a bridle, bit, reins, saddle, stirrups, and spurs. A nightmare equipped with infernal tack must serve whoever wears the spurs until the wearer dies or the tack is removed.

You can use an action to call a nightmare equipped with infernal tack by clashing the spurs together or scraping them through blood. The nightmare appears at the start of your next turn, within 20 feet of you. It acts as your ally and takes its turn on your initiative count. It remains for 1 day, until you or it dies, or until you dismiss it as an action. If the nightmare dies, it reforms in the Nine Hells within 24 hours, after which you can summon it again.

The tack doesn't conjure a nightmare from thin air; one must first be subdued so the tack can be placed on it. No nightmare accepts this forced servitude willingly, but some eventually form strong loyalties to their masters and become true partners in evil.

Source: MTF, page 167. Also found in BGDIA, page 224.

"to get back, or upgrade, a body part: (Sibriex from Mordenkainen) Dem on Grafters. Sibriexes can channel the power of the Abyss to create new demons from other creatures. Over the course of days, they can create vast numbers of rutterkins to protect their lands and to ensure that the plane teems with destructive monsters. Some de- mons petition sibriexes for physical gifts, and if they are moved to do so, sibriexes can graft on new body parts
to give the demons greater strength, vision, or stamina. Sibriexes never give aid freely; they demand a service or a treasure in return for the flesh-shaping they provide."
